page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area lies between the {foothills of the Quantocks and Brendon {Hills}and is part of an area designated as Outstanding Natural Beauty. The land rises to 250 metres at Ashbeer in the south west of this area. The{Doniford River}bisects the north eastern corner of this block. The land on either side of the river is for the most part poorly drained. This area has remained virtually {unspoilt for many hundreds of years. } Many farms remain under 80 hectares surrounded by{ancient hedgerows. } Sheep and dairy cattle farming are the main source of income. The focal point of the block is Stogumber village to the north.
